step.content: Open the desktop application and ensure the left menu is expanded.
step.expected: The left menu is expanded, showing the History list, Settings button, About button, Add new workflow button, and Delete all workflows button.

step.content: Check the History list for the presence of workflows.
step.expected: The History list displays a list of workflows.

step.content: Verify that the workflows are categorized by creation date: Today, Yesterday, Last week.
step.expected: The workflows are categorized into sections labeled Today, Yesterday, and Last week.

step.content: Navigate to the main view of the application.
step.expected: The main view should display the left menu, History list, Settings button, About button, and buttons for Add new workflow and Delete all workflows.

step.content: Click on the collapse icon next to the History list.
step.expected: The History list should collapse, hiding the workflow items.

step.content: Click on the expand icon next to the History list.
step.expected: The History list should expand, displaying the workflow items categorized by Today, Yesterday, and Last week.

step.content: Click on the collapse icon again.
step.expected: The History list should collapse again, hiding the workflow items.

step.content: Click on the expand icon again.
step.expected: The History list should expand again, displaying the workflow items categorized by Today, Yesterday, and Last week.

step.content: Click on the three dots in a workflow's title row in the left menu.
step.expected: A window opens displaying the workflow's name, description, and creation date.

step.content: Check the workflow's name in the window.
step.expected: The name matches the name of the workflow in the left menu.

step.content: Check the workflow's description in the window.
step.expected: The description matches the description of the workflow in the left menu.

step.content: Check the workflow's creation date in the window.
step.expected: The creation date matches the creation date of the workflow in the left menu.

step.content: Click the 'Edit' button in the window.
step.expected: A new window opens allowing the user to modify the name and description.

step.content: Modify the name and description in the 'Edit' window.
step.expected: The changes are reflected in the workflow's details in the left menu.

step.content: Click the 'Delete' button in the window.
step.expected: A confirmation dialog appears asking if you want to delete the workflow.

step.content: Click 'OK' in the confirmation dialog.
step.expected: The workflow is removed from the left menu.

step.content: Click the three dots again to close the workflow options window.
step.expected: The workflow options window closes.

step.content: Open the workflow options window by clicking on the three dots in a workflow's title row in the left menu.
step.expected: The workflow options window opens, displaying the workflow's name, description, and creation date.

step.content: Click on the 'Edit' button in the workflow options window.
step.expected: The workflow name and description fields become editable.

step.content: Modify the workflow name and description with new values.
step.expected: The workflow name and description fields reflect the new values entered.

step.content: Click on the 'Save' button in the workflow options window.
step.expected: The workflow options window closes, and the workflow name and description in the main view are updated with the new values.

step.content: Verify the workflow name and description in the main view.
step.expected: The workflow name and description in the main view match the updated values entered in the workflow options window.

step.content: Navigate to the left menu and expand it to view the list of workflows.
step.expected: The left menu expands, displaying the list of workflows.

step.content: Locate the workflow you want to delete and click on the three dots in the title row of that workflow.
step.expected: A window opens displaying the workflow's name, description, and creation date, along with Edit and Delete buttons.

step.content: Click on the Delete button in the workflow options window.
step.expected: A confirmation dialog appears asking if you are sure you want to delete the workflow.

step.content: Confirm the deletion by clicking on the 'Yes' or 'Delete' button in the confirmation dialog.
step.expected: The workflow is deleted, and the workflow options window closes.

step.content: Check the list of workflows to ensure the deleted workflow is no longer present.
step.expected: The deleted workflow is no longer visible in the list of workflows.

step.content: Navigate to the left menu and expand it if it is not already expanded.
step.expected: The left menu should expand, showing the list of workflows and the Settings and About buttons.

step.content: Locate the workflow for which you want to open the options window and click on the three dots in its title row.
step.expected: The workflow options window should open, displaying the workflow's name, description, and creation date, along with the Edit and Delete buttons.

step.content: Click the three dots in the workflow options window again.
step.expected: The workflow options window should close.

step.content: Open the Settings window by clicking the Settings button.
step.expected: The Settings window opens with options for Theme, Workflow Layout, and a close icon.

step.content: Click on the Theme dropdown and select 'Light mode'.
step.expected: The application's interface changes to light mode.

step.content: Click on the Theme dropdown and select 'Dark mode'.
step.expected: The application's interface changes to dark mode.

step.content: Click on the Theme dropdown and select 'System mode'.
step.expected: The application's interface changes to the system's default theme.

step.content: Close the Settings window by clicking the close icon.
step.expected: The Settings window closes.

step.content: Open the Settings window by clicking the 'Settings' button on the left menu.
step.expected: The Settings window opens displaying options for Theme, Workflow Layout, and a close icon.

step.content: Select 'Horizontal' as the Workflow Layout option.
step.expected: The Workflow Layout option is set to 'Horizontal'.

step.content: Click 'Save' to apply the settings.
step.expected: The settings are saved, and the workflow layout changes to horizontal.

step.content: Open a workflow to verify the layout.
step.expected: The workflow is displayed in a horizontal layout.

step.content: Return to the Settings window and select 'Vertical' as the Workflow Layout option.
step.expected: The Workflow Layout option is set to 'Vertical'.

step.content: Click 'Save' to apply the settings.
step.expected: The settings are saved, and the workflow layout changes to vertical.

step.content: Open the same workflow to verify the layout.
step.expected: The workflow is displayed in a vertical layout.

step.content: Verify that old workflows retain their existing user-defined layout settings.
step.expected: Old workflows retain their existing layout settings regardless of the new default layout selection.

case.title: Verify Retention of Old Workflow Settings

step.content: Open the application and navigate to the 'Settings' window.
step.expected: The 'Settings' window should open.

step.content: In the 'Settings' window, change the 'Workflow Layout' to 'Horizontal'.
step.expected: The 'Workflow Layout' should change to 'Horizontal'.

step.content: Click 'Save' to apply the new settings.
step.expected: The new settings should be saved.

step.content: Navigate to an existing workflow that has been set to a 'Vertical' layout.
step.expected: The existing workflow should still display in the 'Vertical' layout.

step.content: Verify that the layout of the existing workflow has not changed.
step.expected: The layout of the existing workflow should remain 'Vertical'.

step.content: Close the 'Settings' window.
step.expected: The 'Settings' window should close.

step.content: Navigate to the left menu and click on the Settings button.
step.expected: The Settings window should open.

step.content: Locate the close icon in the Settings window.
step.expected: The close icon should be visible and clickable.

step.content: Click on the close icon in the Settings window.
step.expected: The Settings window should close and disappear from the screen.

step.content: Click on the 'About' button to open the About window.
step.expected: The About window opens displaying the correct content.

step.content: Verify that the text 'Cyoda AI Assistant' is displayed in the About window.
step.expected: The text 'Cyoda AI Assistant' is displayed in the About window.

step.content: Check for the presence of the text 'Some icons are still the property of Webalys LLC (https://streamlinehq.com) and can be used only in the context of the open-source project.'
step.expected: The specified text is present in the About window.

step.content: Verify that the text 'Certain images used in this project are sourced from Freepik under their Premium License and are not covered by the project’s open-source license.' is displayed.
step.expected: The specified text is displayed in the About window.

step.content: Check for the presence of the text 'By using this service, you confirm that you have read and agree to our Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy.'
step.expected: The specified text is displayed in the About window.

step.content: Verify that the copyright information 'Copyright © 2025 CYODA Ltd.' is displayed.
step.expected: The copyright information 'Copyright © 2025 CYODA Ltd.' is displayed in the About window.

step.content: Check that the hyperlinks in the About window are functional.
step.expected: The hyperlinks in the About window are functional and open the correct web pages.

step.content: Click on the close button of the About window.
step.expected: The About window closes.

step.content: Expand the left menu by clicking on the expand button.
step.expected: The left menu should expand, displaying all buttons.

step.content: Click on the 'Settings' button in the expanded menu.
step.expected: The Settings window should open.

step.content: Click on the 'About' button in the expanded menu.
step.expected: The About window should open.

step.content: Click on the 'Add new workflow' button in the expanded menu.
step.expected: A new workflow creation window should open.

step.content: Click on the 'Delete all workflows' button in the expanded menu.
step.expected: All existing workflows should be removed.

step.content: Collapse the left menu by clicking on the collapse button.
step.expected: The left menu should collapse, hiding all buttons.

step.content: Click on the 'Settings' button in the collapsed menu.
step.expected: The Settings window should open.

step.content: Click on the 'About' button in the collapsed menu.
step.expected: The About window should open.

step.content: Click on the 'Add new workflow' button in the collapsed menu.
step.expected: A new workflow creation window should open.

step.content: Click on the 'Delete all workflows' button in the collapsed menu.
step.expected: All existing workflows should be removed.

step.content: Click on the 'Add new workflow' button.
step.expected: A new workflow creation window opens.

step.content: Enter a valid Workflow Name (up to 100 characters).
step.expected: The Workflow Name is accepted without any error messages.

step.content: Enter a valid Description (up to 500 characters).
step.expected: The Description is accepted without any error messages.

step.content: Click on the 'Create' button.
step.expected: The new workflow is created and added to the workflow list.

step.content: Verify the workflow appears in the workflow list with the entered name and description.
step.expected: The workflow is listed with the correct name and description.

case.title: Create Workflow with Empty Workflow Name

step.content: Navigate to the main view of the application.
step.expected: The main view is displayed with the left menu, History list, Settings, About, and workflow buttons visible.

step.content: Click on the 'Add new workflow' button.
step.expected: A new workflow creation window opens.

step.content: In the workflow creation window, leave the 'Workflow Name' field empty and click the 'Create' button.
step.expected: An error message or validation message appears, indicating that the Workflow Name cannot be empty.

step.content: Observe the error message or validation message.
step.expected: The error message or validation message should clearly state that the Workflow Name is required and cannot be left empty.

step.content: Navigate to the main workflow view and click on the 'Add new workflow' button.
step.expected: A new workflow creation window should appear.

step.content: In the workflow creation window, enter a name for the workflow in the 'Workflow Name' field.
step.expected: The 'Workflow Name' field should accept the entered name.

step.content: Leave the 'Description' field empty and click on the 'Create' button.
step.expected: The system should not allow the workflow to be created and should display an error message indicating that the description is required.

step.content: Click Create
step.expected: The description is not required and can be left empty.

step.content: Click on the 'Add new workflow' button.
step.expected: A new workflow creation window opens.

step.content: In the workflow creation window, enter a name and a description for the workflow.
step.expected: The entered name and description appear in the respective fields.

step.content: Click on the 'Cancel' button in the workflow creation window.
step.expected: The workflow creation window closes without saving the workflow.

step.content: Check the list of workflows in the main view.
step.expected: The newly created workflow is not present in the list.

step.content: Click on the 'Add new workflow' button to open the workflow creation dialog.
step.expected: The workflow creation dialog should appear with fields for Workflow Name and Description, and buttons for close, cancel, and create.

step.content: Click on the 'Close' button in the workflow creation dialog.
step.expected: The workflow creation dialog should close, and the main workflow view should be displayed without any changes to the existing workflows.

step.content: Navigate to the main view of the application where the workflow history is displayed.
step.expected: The main view should display a list of all workflows, a Settings button, an About button, and the Delete all workflows button.

step.content: Click on the Delete all workflows button.
step.expected: A confirmation dialog should appear asking if you are sure you want to delete all workflows.

step.content: Confirm the deletion in the dialog by clicking the confirm button.
step.expected: All workflows should be removed from the history list, and the list should be empty.

step.content: Check the history list to ensure that no workflows are present.
step.expected: The history list should be empty, showing no workflows.

step.content: Open the application and navigate to the main workflow view.
step.expected: The main workflow view should be displayed with various states.

step.content: Locate the start state in the workflow.
step.expected: The start state should have a triangle symbol in the state name.

step.content: Locate the end state in the workflow.
step.expected: The end state should have a square symbol in the state name.

step.content: Locate a middle state in the workflow.
step.expected: The middle state should have no additional symbols, only the state name.

step.content: Open a workflow with transitions.
step.expected: The workflow should open with visible transitions.

step.content: Double-click on a transition to open the Transition Editor.
step.expected: The Transition Editor should open with the transition data displayed.

step.content: Check the transition icons and their corresponding counts.
step.expected: The icons should match the expected visual representation (dashed line for manual, solid line for automatic) and the counts should reflect the correct quantity.

step.content: Close the Transition Editor and return to the main workflow view.
step.expected: The workflow should remain in the same state with the transitions still visible.

step.content: Double-click on another transition to open the Transition Editor again.
step.expected: The Transition Editor should open with the new transition data displayed.

step.content: Verify the transition icons and their corresponding counts again.
step.expected: The icons should match the expected visual representation and the counts should reflect the correct quantity.

step.content: Open the desktop application and navigate to the main workflow view.
step.expected: The main workflow view should be displayed with the workflow diagram visible.

step.content: Locate a transition line between two states in the workflow diagram.
step.expected: A transition line should be visible between the two states.

step.content: Double-click on the transition line.
step.expected: The transition editor window should open, displaying the transition data in JSON format.

step.content: In the transition editor window, check the Mode toggle between Automatic and Manual.
step.expected: The Mode toggle should switch between Automatic and Manual, showing the corresponding visual representation of the transition.

step.content: Verify the visual representation of the transition based on the mode selected.
step.expected: For Manual mode, the transition should be represented by a dashed line and a gray transition name. For Automatic mode, the transition should be represented by a solid line and a white transition name.

step.content: Close the transition editor window by clicking the 'Close' button.
step.expected: The transition editor window should close, and the workflow diagram should be visible again.

step.content: Open the application and create a new workflow.
step.expected: A new workflow is created with default settings.

step.content: Switch to the Editor view and add a new state.
step.expected: A new state is added to the workflow in the Editor view.

step.content: Switch to the Preview view and observe the changes.
step.expected: The new state added in the Editor view is visible in the Preview view.

step.content: Switch back to the Editor view and modify the name of the new state.
step.expected: The state name is updated in the Editor view.

step.content: Switch to the Preview view and observe the changes in the state name.
step.expected: The updated state name is visible in the Preview view.

step.content: Switch to the Editor view and delete the state.
step.expected: The state is removed from the workflow in the Editor view.

step.content: Switch to the Preview view and observe the changes.
step.expected: The state is no longer visible in the Preview view.

step.content: Open the application and navigate to the main workflow view.
step.expected: The main workflow view is displayed with the Editor, Editor and Preview, and Preview view modes available.

step.content: Click on the 'Import all' button in the top-right corner.
step.expected: The Import window opens with a drag and drop or click to select file area, and a close button.

step.content: Select an example JSON file from the provided list and click 'Open' to import it.
step.expected: The selected JSON file is imported, and the workflow is displayed in the Preview window by default.

step.content: Verify the appearance of the imported workflow in the Preview window.
step.expected: The workflow is displayed in the Preview window with the JSON text shown in either a vertical or horizontal format, as configured by the user in Settings.

step.content: Double-click on a transition name in the Preview window to open the JSON data.
step.expected: The JSON data for the selected transition is displayed in detail, showing all processors and criteria.

step.content: Switch between the Editor, Editor and Preview, and Preview view modes.
step.expected: Any changes made in the Preview are immediately reflected in the Editor, and vice-versa.

step.content: Verify that the diagram settings are saved when switching between different workflows.
step.expected: The diagram settings are saved and do not change when switching between different workflows.

step.content: Open the desktop application and navigate to the main workflow view.
step.expected: The main workflow view is displayed.

step.content: Locate an empty area on the canvas.
step.expected: An empty area on the canvas is visible.

step.content: Double-click on the empty area of the canvas.
step.expected: A new state creation window appears.

step.content: In the new state creation window, enter a name for the new state.
step.expected: The name entered is displayed in the state creation window.

step.content: Click the 'OK' button in the new state creation window.
step.expected: A new state is created on the canvas with the entered name.

step.content: Verify that the new state is visible on the canvas.
step.expected: The new state is visible on the canvas with the entered name.

step.content: Open the desktop application and navigate to the main workflow view.
step.expected: The main workflow view should be displayed with the workflow diagram.

step.content: Hold down the left mouse button and drag the mouse across the canvas.
step.expected: The canvas should move in the direction of the mouse drag.

step.content: Release the left mouse button.
step.expected: The canvas should stop moving.

step.content: Repeat the panning action in different directions.
step.expected: The canvas should move smoothly in each direction without any lag or freezing.

step.content: Hold down the right mouse button and move the mouse to pan the diagram.
step.expected: The diagram should move in the direction the mouse is moved.

step.content: Use the mouse wheel to zoom in on the diagram.
step.expected: The diagram should zoom in, making the elements larger.

step.content: Use the mouse wheel to zoom out on the diagram.
step.expected: The diagram should zoom out, making the elements smaller.

step.content: Open the workflow application and navigate to the main workflow view.
step.expected: The main workflow view is displayed with the workflow diagram.

step.content: Select a state within the workflow diagram by clicking on it.
step.expected: The selected state is highlighted or outlined to indicate it is selected.

step.content: Hold down the left mouse button and drag the selected state to a new location within the canvas.
step.expected: The state moves to the new location as the mouse is dragged.

step.content: Release the left mouse button to drop the state in the new location.
step.expected: The state is placed in the new location and remains there.

step.content: Select a transition name by clicking on it.
step.expected: The selected transition name is highlighted or outlined to indicate it is selected.

step.content: Hold down the left mouse button and drag the selected transition name to a new location within the canvas.
step.expected: The transition name moves to the new location as the mouse is dragged.

step.content: Release the left mouse button to drop the transition name in the new location.
step.expected: The transition name is placed in the new location and remains there.

step.content: Open the desktop application and navigate to the main workflow view.
step.expected: The main workflow view is displayed with the workflow diagram.

step.content: Double-click on the label of a state within the workflow diagram.
step.expected: A text editor appears with the current state name selected.

step.content: Enter a new name for the state and click the 'ok' button.
step.expected: The state label is updated to the new name in the workflow diagram.

step.content: Verify that the new state name is displayed correctly in the workflow diagram.
step.expected: The workflow diagram shows the state with the new name.

step.content: Double-click on the state label again and click the 'cancel' button.
step.expected: The state label reverts to its previous name in the workflow diagram.

step.content: Verify that the state name has reverted to its original name.
step.expected: The workflow diagram shows the state with the original name.

step.content: Open the workflow diagram in the Preview mode.
step.expected: The workflow diagram is displayed in the Preview mode.

step.content: Select the first state by clicking on it.
step.expected: The first state is selected, indicated by a border or highlight.

step.content: Drag the transition line from the first state to the second state.
step.expected: A transition line is created between the two states.

step.content: Double-click the transition line to open the transition editor.
step.expected: The transition editor window opens with the transition data.

step.content: In the transition editor, enter a transition name and click 'Save'.
step.expected: The transition name is saved, and the transition editor window closes.

step.content: Verify the transition in the workflow diagram.
step.expected: The transition line is displayed between the two states with the entered transition name.

step.content: Open a workflow with at least two states and a transition between them.
step.expected: The workflow should open with the states and transition visible.

step.content: Select the transition line by clicking on it.
step.expected: The transition line should be highlighted or selected.

step.content: Click and drag one end of the transition line to a new position on the canvas.
step.expected: The transition line should move to the new position, adjusting the connection between the states.

step.content: Release the mouse button to drop the transition line in the new position.
step.expected: The transition line should remain in the new position, and the states should be connected accordingly.

step.content: Verify that the transition line is correctly positioned and connected to the states.
step.expected: The transition line should be visually connected to the correct states in the new position.

step.content: Double-click on the transition line to open the transition editor.
step.expected: The transition editor window should open with the transition data displayed.

step.content: Check the JSON data in the transition editor to ensure it reflects the new position of the transition.
step.expected: The JSON data should show updated 'x' and 'y' coordinates for the transition's endpoints.

step.content: Close the transition editor window.
step.expected: The transition editor window should close, and the workflow should return to the main view.

step.content: Save the workflow.
step.expected: The workflow should be saved with the updated transition position.

step.content: Open the workflow in the Editor view.
step.expected: The workflow should be displayed in the Editor view.

step.content: Select the transition line between the two states.
step.expected: The transition line should be highlighted or selected.

step.content: Press the 'Delete' key on the keyboard.
step.expected: The selected transition line should be removed from the workflow.

step.content: Verify that the transition line is no longer visible.
step.expected: The transition line should no longer be visible between the two states.

step.content: Switch to the Preview view to confirm the transition is deleted.
step.expected: The Preview view should reflect the removal of the transition line.

step.content: Double-click on a transition name to open the Transition Editor.
step.expected: The Transition Editor window opens with the transition data displayed in a JSON editor.

step.content: Edit the JSON data in the Transition Editor.
step.expected: The JSON data is updated in the editor.

step.content: Toggle the Mode between Automatic and Manual.
step.expected: The transition visual representation changes accordingly: Manual transitions are represented by a dashed line and a gray transition name, while Automatic transitions have a solid line and a white transition name.

step.content: Click the 'Save' button to save the changes.
step.expected: The Transition Editor window closes and the changes are reflected in the workflow diagram.

step.content: Double-click on the transition name again to open the Transition Editor.
step.expected: The Transition Editor window opens with the updated JSON data displayed.

step.content: Click the 'Cancel' button to discard the changes.
step.expected: The Transition Editor window closes without saving the changes.

step.content: Double-click on the transition name again to open the Transition Editor.
step.expected: The Transition Editor window opens with the original JSON data displayed.

step.content: Navigate to the main workflow view and switch to the Editor view mode.
step.expected: The workflow diagram should be displayed in the Editor view mode with all functionalities accessible.

step.content: Check for the presence of the toolbar buttons in the Editor view mode.
step.expected: The toolbar should have buttons such as Zoom in, Zoom out, Lock interaction, Fit to view, Undo, Redo, Reset position, Switch to horizontal/vertical layout, and Add new state.

step.content: Use the 'Add new state' button to open the window and enter a state name.
step.expected: The 'Add new state' window should open with fields to enter the state name and buttons to close, cancel, and ok.

step.content: Use the 'Workflow settings' button to open the window and edit the JSON content.
step.expected: The 'Workflow settings' window should open with an editor containing JSON content and buttons to close, cancel, and save.

step.content: Perform standard interactions such as panning, zooming, and state creation.
step.expected: The interactions should work as expected: panning by holding the right mouse button, zooming with the mouse wheel, and opening the 'Add new state' window by double-clicking on the canvas.

step.content: Drag and drop states and transition names to manipulate the diagram.
step.expected: States and transition names should be draggable and can be dropped to new positions.

step.content: Move both ends of transition lines and add new transitions.
step.expected: Transition lines should be movable, and new transitions should be added successfully.

step.content: Delete any element by selecting it and pressing the 'Delete' key on the keyboard.
step.expected: The selected element should be deleted.

step.content: Double-click on a state to rename it and confirm or cancel the changes.
step.expected: The state should be renamed if confirmed, and no changes should be made if canceled.

step.content: Double-click on a transition name to open the transition editor and edit the transition data.
step.expected: The transition editor window should open with a JSON editor, Mode toggle, and buttons to close, cancel, and save.

step.content: Verify that any changes made in the Preview are immediately reflected in the Editor, and vice-versa.
step.expected: Changes in the Preview should be reflected in the Editor, and changes in the Editor should be reflected in the Preview.

step.content: Navigate to the main workflow view and select the 'Editor and Preview' view mode.
step.expected: The main workflow view should display both the Editor and Preview panes side by side.

step.content: In the Editor pane, make changes to the workflow diagram.
step.expected: The changes made in the Editor pane should be immediately reflected in the Preview pane.

step.content: In the Preview pane, make changes to the workflow diagram.
step.expected: The changes made in the Preview pane should be immediately reflected in the Editor pane.

step.content: Use the toolbar buttons to perform actions such as zooming, undoing, and adding new states in the Editor pane.
step.expected: The actions should be performed successfully, and the changes should be reflected in the Preview pane.

step.content: Use the toolbar buttons to perform actions such as zooming, undoing, and adding new states in the Preview pane.
step.expected: The actions should be performed successfully, and the changes should be reflected in the Editor pane.

step.content: Switch between the 'Editor' and 'Preview' view modes.
step.expected: The view mode should switch correctly, and the changes made in one view should be reflected in the other.

step.content: Switch to the Preview view mode by selecting it from the view mode options.
step.expected: The Preview window should display the workflow diagram with the JSON text in the configured vertical or horizontal format.

step.content: Check the toolbar buttons in the Preview view mode.
step.expected: All toolbar buttons should be accessible and functional, including Zoom in, Zoom out, Lock interaction, Fit to view, Undo, Redo, Reset position, Switch to horizontal/vertical layout, and Add new state.

step.content: Use the Panning feature to move the diagram by holding down the right mouse button and dragging.
step.expected: The diagram should move smoothly as the mouse is dragged.

step.content: Use the Zooming feature to zoom in and out with the mouse wheel.
step.expected: The diagram should zoom in when scrolling forward and zoom out when scrolling backward.

step.content: Double-click on the canvas to open the 'Add new state' window.
step.expected: The 'Add new state' window should open with a field to Enter state name and buttons to close, cancel, and ok.

step.content: Drag and drop states and transition names to manipulate the diagram.
step.expected: States and transition names should be draggable and droppable, allowing for rearrangement of elements.

step.content: Move both ends of transition lines and add new transitions.
step.expected: Transition lines should be movable, and new transitions should be added successfully.

step.content: Delete any element by selecting it and pressing the 'Delete' key on the keyboard.
step.expected: The selected element should be removed from the diagram.

step.content: Double-click on a state to rename it and confirm or cancel the changes.
step.expected: The state name should be editable, and the changes should be confirmed or canceled as expected.

step.content: Double-click on a transition name to open the transition editor window.
step.expected: The transition editor window should open with a Transition Data (JSON) editor and buttons to close, cancel, and save.

step.content: Edit the transition data and toggle between Automatic and Manual modes.
step.expected: The transition data should be editable, and the mode toggle should switch between Automatic and Manual as expected.

step.content: Verify the visual representation of manual and automatic transitions.
step.expected: Manual transitions should be represented by a dashed line and a gray transition name, while automatic transitions should be represented by a solid line and a white transition name.

step.content: Double-click on a transition name to open the JSON data and check the detailed view.
step.expected: The JSON data should be displayed in detail, showing all processors and criteria.

step.content: Make changes in the Preview and verify that they are reflected in the Editor.
step.expected: Any changes made in the Preview should be immediately reflected in the Editor, and vice-versa.

step.content: Open the desktop application and navigate to the 'Main Workflow View'.
step.expected: The main workflow view is displayed.

step.content: Switch to the 'Preview' view mode.
step.expected: The workflow is displayed in the Preview view.

step.content: Ensure that the 'Workflow Layout' in 'Settings' is set to 'vertical'.
step.expected: The 'Workflow Layout' is set to 'vertical'.

step.content: Add some JSON text to the workflow.
step.expected: The JSON text is added to the workflow.

step.content: Observe the JSON display in the 'Preview' window.
step.expected: The JSON text is displayed in a vertical format in the 'Preview' window.

step.content: Navigate to the Settings window and select 'Horizontal' as the default Workflow Layout.
step.expected: The default Workflow Layout is set to 'Horizontal'.

step.content: Create a new workflow and enter JSON content in the Workflow Settings editor.
step.expected: The JSON content is entered successfully.

step.content: Switch to the Preview view mode.
step.expected: The JSON content is displayed in the Preview window in a horizontal format.

step.content: Verify that the JSON content is displayed correctly in the horizontal layout.
step.expected: The JSON content is displayed in a horizontal layout without any formatting issues.

step.content: Open the application and navigate to the main workflow view.
step.expected: The main workflow view is displayed.

step.content: Switch to the Editor view mode.
step.expected: The workflow is displayed in the Editor view mode.

step.content: Click the Zoom In button.
step.expected: The workflow zooms in, making the elements appear larger.

step.content: Switch to the Editor and Preview view mode.
step.expected: The workflow is displayed in the Editor and Preview view mode.

step.content: Click the Zoom In button again.
step.expected: The workflow zooms in, making the elements appear larger.

step.content: Switch to the Preview view mode.
step.expected: The workflow is displayed in the Preview view mode.

step.content: Click the Zoom In button once more.
step.expected: The workflow zooms in, making the elements appear larger.

step.content: Open the application and navigate to the main workflow view.
step.expected: The main workflow view should be displayed with the workflow diagram.

step.content: Switch to the Editor view mode.
step.expected: The workflow diagram should be displayed in the Editor view mode.

step.content: Click the Zoom Out button.
step.expected: The workflow diagram should zoom out, reducing the size of the displayed elements.

step.content: Switch to the Editor and Preview view mode.
step.expected: The workflow diagram should be displayed in both the Editor and Preview view modes.

step.content: Click the Zoom Out button.
step.expected: The workflow diagram should zoom out, reducing the size of the displayed elements.

step.content: Switch to the Preview view mode.
step.expected: The workflow diagram should be displayed in the Preview view mode.

step.content: Click the Zoom Out button.
step.expected: The workflow diagram should zoom out, reducing the size of the displayed elements.

step.content: Open the application and navigate to the main workflow view.
step.expected: The main workflow view is displayed with the toolbar visible.

step.content: Click on the Lock Interaction button in the toolbar.
step.expected: The Lock Interaction button toggles its state (e.g., from locked to unlocked or vice versa). The interaction with the workflow diagram should be disabled.

step.content: Switch to the Editor view mode.
step.expected: The view mode changes to Editor, and the Lock Interaction button should still be in the same state as before.

step.content: Click on the Lock Interaction button again in the Editor view mode.
step.expected: The Lock Interaction button toggles its state, and the interaction with the workflow diagram should be enabled or disabled accordingly.

step.content: Switch to the Editor and Preview view mode.
step.expected: The view mode changes to Editor and Preview, and the Lock Interaction button should still be in the same state as before.

step.content: Click on the Lock Interaction button again in the Editor and Preview view mode.
step.expected: The Lock Interaction button toggles its state, and the interaction with the workflow diagram should be enabled or disabled accordingly.

step.content: Switch to the Preview view mode.
step.expected: The view mode changes to Preview, and the Lock Interaction button should still be in the same state as before.

step.content: Click on the Lock Interaction button again in the Preview view mode.
step.expected: The Lock Interaction button toggles its state, and the interaction with the workflow diagram should be enabled or disabled accordingly.

step.content: Switch to the Editor view mode.
step.expected: The Editor view mode is displayed.

step.content: Click the Fit to View button.
step.expected: The diagram zooms out to fit the entire workflow within the view.

step.content: Switch to the Editor and Preview view mode.
step.expected: The Editor and Preview view mode is displayed.

step.content: Click the Fit to View button.
step.expected: The diagram zooms out to fit the entire workflow within the view in both Editor and Preview panes.

step.content: Switch to the Preview view mode.
step.expected: The Preview view mode is displayed.

step.content: Click the Fit to View button.
step.expected: The diagram zooms out to fit the entire workflow within the view.

case.title: Verify Diagram Settings Saved When Switching Workflows

step.content: Open the application and create a new workflow.
step.expected: A new workflow is created and displayed.

step.content: Switch to the Editor view mode.
step.expected: The workflow is displayed in the Editor view mode.

step.content: Switch to the Editor and Preview view mode.
step.expected: The workflow is displayed in the Editor and Preview view mode.

step.content: Switch to the Preview view mode.
step.expected: The workflow is displayed in the Preview view mode.

step.content: Switch back to the Editor view mode.
step.expected: The workflow is displayed in the Editor view mode with the same settings as before.

step.content: Switch back to the Editor and Preview view mode.
step.expected: The workflow is displayed in the Editor and Preview view mode with the same settings as before.

step.content: Switch back to the Preview view mode.
step.expected: The workflow is displayed in the Preview view mode with the same settings as before.

step.content: Create a new workflow and switch between different workflows.
step.expected: The diagram settings are preserved when switching between different workflows.

case.title: Check Initial Display for Overlap of Working Elements

step.content: Open a large workflow in the application.
step.expected: The workflow should open without any elements overlapping.

step.content: Pan across the workflow to ensure all elements are visible without overlap.
step.expected: All elements should be visible without any overlap.

step.content: Switch between different view modes (Editor, Editor and Preview, Preview).
step.expected: There should be no overlap of working elements in any view mode.

case.title: Verify Element Selection by Mouse Click

step.content: Open the application and navigate to the main workflow view.
step.expected: The workflow diagram is displayed.

step.content: Click on a state element within the workflow diagram.
step.expected: The clicked state element is selected, indicated by a border or highlight.

step.content: Click on an empty area within the workflow diagram.
step.expected: The previously selected state element is deselected.

step.content: Click on a transition element within the workflow diagram.
step.expected: The clicked transition element is selected, indicated by a border or highlight.

step.content: Click on an empty area within the workflow diagram.
step.expected: The previously selected transition element is deselected.

case.title: Verify Settings When Switching Between Editor and Preview

step.content: Open the application and create a new workflow.
step.expected: A new workflow is created with default settings.

step.content: Switch to the Editor view and set a custom layout (e.g., horizontal).
step.expected: The layout changes to horizontal as expected.

step.content: Switch to the Preview view.
step.expected: The layout remains horizontal, as set in the Editor view.

step.content: Switch back to the Editor view.
step.expected: The layout remains horizontal, as set in the Editor view.

step.content: Switch to the Editor and Preview view.
step.expected: The layout remains horizontal, as set in the Editor view.

step.content: Switch back to the Editor view.
step.expected: The layout remains horizontal, as set in the Editor view.

step.content: Switch to the Preview view.
step.expected: The layout remains horizontal, as set in the Editor view.

step.content: Close the workflow and reopen it.
step.expected: The layout remains horizontal, as set in the previous session.

step.content: Navigate to the top-right corner of the application and click on the 'Export all' button.
step.expected: A file dialog should open, allowing the user to select a location to save the exported file.

step.content: Choose a location to save the exported file and click 'Save'.
step.expected: The application should export the dataset and save the file to the chosen location.

step.content: Navigate to the chosen location and open the exported file.
step.expected: The file should open successfully, and the content should match the expected data from the application.

step.content: Navigate to the top-right corner of the application using the Tab key to ensure the focus is on the Export All button.
step.expected: The focus should be on the Export All button, and the screen reader should announce 'Export All button'.

step.content: Press the Enter key while the focus is on the Export All button to activate it.
step.expected: The Export All window should open, and the screen reader should announce 'Export All window open'.

step.content: Use the Tab key to navigate through the Export All window to check if all elements are accessible.
step.expected: The focus should move through the window elements, and the screen reader should announce each element, such as 'Drag and drop area', 'Select file button', and 'Close button'.

step.content: Press the Escape key to close the Export All window.
step.expected: The Export All window should close, and the screen reader should announce 'Export All window closed'.

step.content: Click on the 'Import all' button in the top-right corner of the application.
step.expected: The Import window should open, displaying a drag and drop area and a click to select file area.

step.content: Hover over the drag and drop area in the Import window.
step.expected: The cursor should change to indicate that files can be dropped into the area.

step.content: Drag a file into the drag and drop area in the Import window.
step.expected: The file should be accepted into the area, and a message indicating the file is ready to be imported should appear.

step.content: Click on the 'click to select file' area in the Import window.
step.expected: A file selection dialog should open, allowing the user to choose a file to import.

step.content: Select a file from the file selection dialog and click 'Open'.
step.expected: The selected file should appear in the Import window, ready to be imported.

step.content: Click the 'Close' button on the Import window.
step.expected: The Import window should close.

case.title: Examples of workflows of varying complexity

step.content: Create several new workflows of varying complexity and check that everything is displayed correctly.

case.title: Verify Help and Legend Button Functionality

step.content: Click on the Help and Legend button.
step.expected: The information window opens.

step.content: Verify that the information window displays the correct information.
step.expected: The information window displays the expected content.

step.content: Check the functionality of the close buttons within the information window.
step.expected: Clicking the close buttons closes the information window.

step.content: Navigate to the workflow list and select a single workflow to export.
step.expected: The workflow list should display the selected workflow and the export option should be available.

step.content: Click on the 'export' button for the selected workflow.
step.expected: An export window should open, allowing the user to confirm the export action.

step.content: Confirm the export action in the export window.
step.expected: The export process should start, and a progress indicator should be displayed.

step.content: Once the export is complete, check the download location for the exported file.
step.expected: The exported file should be present in the download location.

step.content: Open the exported file and verify that it is correctly formatted and contains the expected data for the selected workflow.
step.expected: The exported file should be in the correct format (e.g., CSV, JSON) and should contain all the expected data fields for the selected workflow.

step.content: Navigate to the Export section of the application.
step.expected: The Export section is displayed.

step.content: Select multiple workflows to export by checking their respective checkboxes.
step.expected: The selected workflows are highlighted or marked as selected.

step.content: Click the 'Export selected' button.
step.expected: A prompt appears to save the exported file(s).

step.content: Save the exported file(s) to a specified location.
step.expected: The file(s) are saved to the specified location.

step.content: Open each exported file to verify the content.
step.expected: Each file is correctly formatted and contains the expected data for the selected workflows.

step.content: Click on the Export button.
step.expected: An Export window opens displaying a list of existing workflows.

step.content: Check if the list of workflows includes the Workflow Name.
step.expected: The Workflow Name is displayed for each workflow in the list.

step.content: Check if the list of workflows includes the Technical ID.
step.expected: The Technical ID is displayed for each workflow in the list.

step.content: Check if the list of workflows includes the Created at date.
step.expected: The Created at date is displayed for each workflow in the list.

step.content: Verify the checkboxes for workflow selection.
step.expected: Checkboxes are present for each workflow, allowing selection of all or several workflows.

step.content: Click on the 'Select all' button.
step.expected: All workflows are selected.

step.content: Click on the 'Clear selection' button.
step.expected: All workflows are deselected.

step.content: Click on the 'Cancel' button.
step.expected: The Import window closes without importing any workflows.

step.content: Click on the 'Close' button.
step.expected: The Import window closes without importing any workflows.

step.content: Click on the 'Export' button.
step.expected: An 'Export Workflow' window opens with a list of existing workflows.

step.content: Verify that the 'Workflow Name', 'Technical ID', and 'Created at' information for each workflow is displayed correctly.
step.expected: The information for each workflow is displayed correctly.

step.content: Click on the 'Select all' button.
step.expected: All checkboxes for the workflows are selected.

step.content: Click on the 'Clear selection' button.
step.expected: All checkboxes for the workflows are deselected.

step.content: Select a single workflow checkbox.
step.expected: Only the selected workflow checkbox is selected.

step.content: Select multiple workflow checkboxes.
step.expected: Only the selected workflow checkboxes are selected.

step.content: Click on the 'Cancel' button.
step.expected: The 'Import Workflow' window closes without importing any workflows.

step.content: Click on the 'Close' button.
step.expected: The 'Import Workflow' window closes without importing any workflows.
